授業目的: The objective of this course is to learn about India's rapid growth, focusing mainly on its economic development, and to understand its growth and challenges through examples of manufacturing and environmental protection. Students are required to earn 2 credits of “South Asian Society” before this course.
到達目標: Students are to understand the state of India's economic, industrial, and sustainable development through interactive online learning delivered from India, and to identify, analyze, and reflect on issues on their own.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目:
本授業の受講に際しては「南アジア社会論」の2単位を修得済みであること。
Students are required to earn 2 credits of “South Asian Society” before this course.
授業方法:
This course will be held on in face-to-face lessons at the classroom. Students will attend Web seminar(Webinar) by online streaming (interactive format) by Professor Pritee Sharma from Indian Institute of Technology Indore (IIT-Indore) as a guest speaker.
Students are required to take 2 credits of “South Asian Society” before this course.
本授業に際し、受講生は使用教室に来室し、対面にてゲストスピーカーによるオンラインストリーミング授業を受講するウェビナー形式にて参加すること。「オンライン」とあるが、従来の受講生、教員ともにオンライン上で同時双方向でやり取りを行う形式ではない。

第2回: Indian Society (1): Indian Culture and Civilization
第5回: Indian Economy (1): India’s Economic Reforms, Agriculture, Poverty and Development
第6回: Indian Economy (2): Indian International Trade and Policy
第8回: Industries in India (1): Manufacturing Sector, Small and Medium Enterprises
第9回: Industries in India (2): Services Sector, IT and others
第11回: Indian International Relationships with Other Countries
第12回: Sustainable Development in India: Environment and Economic Development
第14回: Discussion and Wrap up for the report writing
